thread.title: Cycling - Belgian rider taken to hospital after crash on Paris-Roubaix

title: Cycling - Belgian rider taken to hospital after crash on Paris-Roubaix
text:
April 8, 2018 / 1:04 PM / Updated 2 hours ago Cycling - Belgian rider taken to hospital after crash on Paris-Roubaix Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ROUBAIX (Reuters) - Belgian rider Michael Goolaerts was taken to hospital after crashing during the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic, his team said on Sunday. 
“Michael Goolaerts was involved in a crash and forced to abandon the race. He was taken to hospital. No further news at the moment,” Veranda’s Willems-Crelan team said in a statement. 
TV footage showed that Goolaerts, 23, was receiving CPR treatment from medics on the side of the road. Reporting by Julien Pretot; Editing by Toby Davis
